metadata.synopsis: The player has delivered Madeline's ledger to He Who Was. The shadar-kai uses the book to channel her spirit. Player can punish her, making her stab herself the way her friends died, verbally admonish her, or forgive her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Teleport to shadarkai, 1,1,1 the quest. Teleport to Harperledger, pick it up and return to shadarkai.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: What do I need to do?

85.speaker: He Who Was
85.text: I seek a record of this one's crimes - a ledger written in her own hand. With it, I can summon her spirit - and force her to face trial.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: What do you get out of it?

94.speaker: He Who Was
94.text: The joy of bringing suffering to the unpunished. Her victims deserve closure, and the ledger is key.

188.speaker: He Who Was
188.text: Go to the distillery, the one she calls The Waning Moon. Find it - and bring it to me.

159.speaker: He Who Was
159.text: And together, we shall mete out justice long overdue.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: No - I don't have time for this.

26.speaker: He Who Was
26.text: Madeline's spirit is within reach. It is time to make her face trial, to make her suffer.
26.context: NodeContext: cold, cruel and with a touch of glee at the end

53.speaker: He Who Was
53.text: Alas, Madeline has fled, and not even my powers can force her to return. I no longer require you.

66.speaker: He Who Was
66.text: The raven's-favoured returns. What have you brought?

196.speaker: He Who Was
196.text: The ledger lies in The Waning Moon. Retrieve it, or this murderer will go unpunished.

124.speaker: He Who Was
124.text: This one is a murderer who walks free. She deserves to be punished. Or will you deny her victims peace?
124.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the playeer

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Fine. What do I have to do?

187.speaker: He Who Was
187.text: Your soul is lit with a grace few possess. It is... blinding.
187.context: NodeContext: trying to manipulate the player with a compliment, he doesn't really mean this

82.speaker: Player
82.text: No. I don't have time for this.

104.speaker: He Who Was
104.text: You have denied her victims any chance of rest. I pray you sleep easy at night.
104.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the player (totally does not hope the player sleeps easy)

126.speaker: He Who Was
126.text: The air stirs in trepidation - you have the ledger.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Tell me why you want it first.

27.speaker: He Who Was
27.text: To punish a murderer. If that is not enough, leave. I have no time for those lacking commitment.
27.context: NodeContext: cold, but a touch of irritation at the end. He wants the ledger, and he doesn't like being made to wait.

112.speaker: He Who Was
112.text: We have it - her lies, her guilt. Madeline reported her friends to a Dark Justiciar and fled when they were butchered.
112.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

161.speaker: He Who Was
161.text: Well, she flees no more. I will be the conduit for Madeline's spirit. I will force her to face trial.
161.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

37.speaker: He Who Was
37.text: And you will be the judge. Make her beg, make her suffer.
37.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I'm here to make sure she sees justice.

101.speaker: He Who Was
101.text: There is no justice for traitors - only pain.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Let's see what she has to say first.

41.speaker: He Who Was
41.text: Careful - for a serpent in life is a serpent in death.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I'm going to punish her - throughly.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I'd like to hear her story first - I imagine it's quite the tale.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: When punishment is needed, my hand will not shy from the blade.

11.speaker: He Who Was
11.text: The raven was right, we were fated to meet. Break her, my friend - most thoroughly.
11.context: NodeContext: pleased the player agrees with him, thinks they are of one mind and both enjoy cruelty

103.speaker: He Who Was
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes roll back in his head as he looks up - body jerkingNodeContext: low, excited voice. Eyes roll back in his head as he looks up - body jerking. Falls to his knees.

19.speaker: Madeline
19.text: You! He said I was gonna be punished, that you'd be the judge. But I didn't mean to hurt anyone!
19.context: NodeContext: on her knees, sees player - terrified. Stands up.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Why don't you tell me what happened?

151.speaker: Player
151.text: You 'didn't mean' to kill your friends? How laughable.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: Well now, let's not throwing stones. Glass houses and all that.

154.speaker: Wyll
154.text: Not as if you can relate to the killing urge, can you? Hmph - I can taste the hypocrisy from here.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: Come now - you're hardly in position to cast judgement on that score, are you?

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: Yes - how laughable. You're above such things as the killing urge.

95.speaker: Madeline
95.text: I said it didn't mean nothin', that Ben n' Marc were just drunk n' whining.
95.context: NodeContext: quietly horrified as she remembers what comes next

200.speaker: Madeline
200.text: The Dark Justiciar promised she was gonna chat with 'em. She promised.
200.context: NodeContext: quietly horrified as she remembers what comes next

30.speaker: Player
30.text: What did the Dark Justiciar actually do to your friends?

79.speaker: Madeline
79.text: She gave 'em a dagger each, and told 'em to press it against their stomachs.
79.context: NodeContext: traumatised and horrified. This is the worst thing that she's ever seen

122.speaker: Madeline
122.text: On the count of three, to 'start stabbin', and not to stop 'til she said so.
122.context: NodeContext: traumatised and horrified. This is the worst thing that she's ever seen

115.speaker: Madeline
115.text: She never said stop. I'd do anything to take it back. Anything.
115.context: NodeContext: eyes closed at memory, voice breaking at the horror. Nearly crying

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I once ended one dear to me. There is no punishment which could atone for it.

174.speaker: Madeline
174.text: You did? But how - how do you live with yourself?
174.context: NodeContext: really hoping the player will give her hope, give her some way to survive with this guilt

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I don't - not really. The image haunts me, leaving me more dead than alive.

83.speaker: Madeline
83.text: I should have known - there's no forgiveness for people like us.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I try to do better by the living.

181.speaker: Madeline
181.text: But I'm dead. I can't do better. Not any more.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Life runs through our fingers like falling rain, nothing we can do.

47.speaker: Madeline
47.text: I should have known - there's no hope for me.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I killed my darling for sport, and I enjoyed it.

42.speaker: Madeline
42.text: I might be a monster, but at least I regret it.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Anything? Then hurt yourself as Ben and Marc did - stab yourself.

58.speaker: Madeline
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Draws a blade form behind and holds it out in front of her, blade pointed towards her stomach.NodeContext: Madeline draws a blade from behind her and holds it in front of her stomach, blade pointed towards her stomach. She is utterly terrified (pose like seppuku)

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Start stabbing, and don't stop until I say so.

16.speaker: Madeline
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself on the Ah! and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: Ah! is a noise of pain as she stabs herself in the stomach and then pulls out the knife. 'I'm sorry' is said in clear pain.

175.speaker: Madeline
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself on the Argh! and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: stabs herself again on 'Argh', noise of pain. I'm so so sorry is half crying as she's in agony.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Did I say stop? Drive the knife in deeper.

189.speaker: Madeline
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself after 'I'm' and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: Grunt of pain after 'I'm' as she stabs herself herself again. knife remains in her left hand as she drops her arm to the side. Sorry is half faded, almost like she's dying from the pain (the shadar kai is about to take over her body)

43.speaker: He Who Was
43.context: NodeContext: Holding knife just about his stomach, as if about to stab himself when he says the line. Roar of absolute fury and pain from the shadar kai as he takes back control. Knife stays in his left hand and moves to his side.

3.speaker: He Who Was
3.text: ARGH! You vile sadist, what have you done to me?
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knife is in his right hand. He drops it.NodeContext: Blinking and shaking as he regains control of his body. Absolutey furious and in pain.

207.speaker: Madeline
207.context: NodeContext: Knife is poised above her stomach and she relaxes, letting the knife remain in her left hand as that arm drifts to the side. Other hand touches her stomach and then she looks at player. In clear pain, voice fading as if she's dying (shadar kai is about to take over her body)

186.speaker: He Who Was
186.text: That was genius, my friend. You have broken her in ways I could not have imagined.
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knife is in his right hand. He drops it.NodeContext: Breath laugh at the beginning and exitement in first sentence. Bloodied knife in his left hand, which he drops. He's shaking, blinking as he takes back control of his body. Returning to calm cold and calculated by end of second line. Cruel smile.

67.speaker: He Who Was
67.text: Though I'd have preferred not bleeding quite so profusely.
67.context: NodeContext: wry sarcasm as he looks over his bleeding body, does not seem bothered by the pain

150.speaker: Player
150.text: What? You said to punish her!

191.speaker: He Who Was
191.text: Not to the point of killing this body!

89.speaker: He Who Was
89.text: You will join me in the darkness of oblivion, you treacherous insect!
89.context: NodeContext: furious and murderous - about to start combat

100.speaker: He Who Was
100.text: I suppose it is on me for not being more specific. But Madeline suffered, that is all that matters.
100.context: NodeContext: sarcasm on first line, cold and cruel on the last

92.speaker: He Who Was
92.text: You have done well. Her pain and anguish were sublime - I will treasure it.

13.speaker: He Who Was
13.text: Here - for your services. However, a friendly warning - be careful, or you may be the next murderer I bring to justice.

1.speaker: He Who Was
1.text: Here - for your services. Should I find another murderer in need of torment, I shall call upon you. Farewell.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: That was fun - can I do it again?

65.speaker: He Who Was
65.text: You dare mock me as I near bleed to death?

145.speaker: He Who Was
145.text: Not until I have recovered, if you wouldn't mind.

61.speaker: He Who Was
61.text: I am the one bleeding out and near death.

31.speaker: He Who Was
31.text: You were the one who forced her to relive the death of her friends - nicely done.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Prove you're sorry. Do it for Ben and Marc.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Stop. You were willing to hurt yourself - that is enough for me.

62.speaker: Madeline
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drops the knife after realising she's forgivenNodeContext: Knife poised abover her stomach, she drops it. Voice flooded with relief and gratitude.

152.speaker: Madeline
152.context: NodeContext: a smile as her eyes roll back in her head, smile on her face (shadar-kai is about to take over her body)

99.speaker: He Who Was
99.text: Argh. You were supposed to make her suffer! Not forgive her.
99.context: NodeContext: He stumbles a little in place as her returns to his body with a jerk. He's utterly furious, vicious and cruel

23.speaker: Player
23.text: What happened wasn't her fault - she deserved forgiveness.

114.speaker: He Who Was
114.text: That doesn't matter! I seek the guilty. The tormented. The anguished.
114.context: NodeContext: this is the most riled up we ever see him (usually cold and calculated)

74.speaker: He Who Was
74.text: You have crossed me, and for that, I end your pathetic life.
74.context: NodeContext: Begins combat after this line, absolute furious

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Do not speak to me like that.

149.speaker: He Who Was
149.text: You're right, now is not the time for talk.
149.context: NodeContext: cold and threatening, preparing to enter combat

198.speaker: Player
198.text: You whine more than she did.

215.speaker: He Who Was
215.text: I thought us of one mind, I see now I was wrong.
215.context: NodeContext: cold and threatening, preparing to enter combat

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You could have fought back. You deserve no forgiveness, COWARD!

209.speaker: Player
209.text: Yours is a classic tale of cowardice. Were you a character in a tale of mine, I would kill you off - immediately.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: You had the means to stop it - you chose not to. You let fear and cowardice rule you.

24.speaker: Madeline
24.text: You're right. I'm a killer. A monster.

91.speaker: Madeline
91.context: NodeContext: voice fading as her eyes roll back in her head, shadar-kai is about to take over. This should be a heartbreaking moment - lots of grief and sorrow

20.speaker: He Who Was
20.text: Ah! Glorious. Look - my hand still shakes.
20.context: NodeContext: returns to his body with a jerk, smiling as he looks at his hand.. Breathy with excitement like he's on a high

80.speaker: He Who Was
80.text: You broke her - most thoroughly. Well done.
80.context: NodeContext: delighted and cruel smile, little breathy as he comes down from the high. Collected and cold by 'well done'

177.speaker: Player
177.text: This was just some perverted fantasy of yours, wasn't it?

111.speaker: He Who Was
111.text: Perhaps, but we both got what we wanted, didn't we?

81.speaker: He Who Was
81.text: You did not harm her as much as I had hoped, but your work was adequate, as will be your reward.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: She was punished - that's all that matters.

139.speaker: He Who Was
139.text: If you are satisfied, than so am I.

132.speaker: He Who Was
132.text: It is pleasing to see we are of one mind.
132.context: NodeContext: cruel smile, he believes him and the player to both we weirdo perverts

179.speaker: Narrator
179.text: *Overwrought with grief, the connection begins to fade.*

194.speaker: Madeline
194.text: I'm sorry, Ben... I'm sorry, Marc... I'm so...
194.context: NodeContext: voice fading as her eyes roll back in her hea, shadar-kai is about to take over

121.speaker: He Who Was
121.text: Ah! A pity - she fades. Her pain was such that even I could not tether her for long.
121.context: NodeContext: returns to his body with a jerk, Dissapointed

52.speaker: He Who Was
52.text: Still, her grief was most potent. It will satiate me for a time.
52.context: NodeContext: a shrug, he still had a good time and that's all that matters. Cruel smile

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Pathetic - you murdered your friends. You're a coward.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Forgiveness comes from within - I cannot gift it to you. But know that I would, if I could.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: When I tell this tale, you won't be the villain - I promise. The Dark Justiciar is to blame.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: There's nothing you need do. This wasn't your fault - I promise.

157.speaker: Madeline
157.text: What I did was wrong - and I won't ever forgive myself.
157.context: NodeContext: player has forgiven her. Madeline is still angry with herself, but there is a quiet gratitude here as she process that a single person in the world doesn't hate her - and how grateful she is for that.

144.speaker: Madeline
144.text: But hearin' that just one person doesn't hate me. That one person forgives me, makes the load so much lighter.
144.context: NodeContext: surprise and immense gratitutude. This is the kindest someone has been to her in a long time. Sad smile.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: By the light of the one I serve, I forgive you. This wasn't your doing.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Stab yourself. Rip your stomach open. Feel the pain of your friends - only then will you be free.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: If it was drunk complaining, why did you report them?

172.speaker: Madeline
172.text: The Dark Justiciar said to report everythin', big or small. She ain't the type you say no to.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Don't blame others for what you did.

146.speaker: Madeline
146.text: You didn't see it. Didn't see what the Dark Justiciar did.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: My gorge rises at your sickening naivety.

60.speaker: Madeline
60.text: No - no that wasn't the worst of it.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: Oh, come on now - it happens to the best of us, from time to time.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Peace - speak your truth. We will go from there.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Blood taints all our hands in ways we never predict.

14.speaker: Madeline
14.text: But - but this wasn't supposed to happen - I swear!

64.speaker: Player
64.text: It's all right, I'm not here to judge you.

197.speaker: Madeline
197.text: You're - you're not? But he said I deserved it. That I'm... evil.
197.context: NodeContext: surprised, madeline thinks she's a piece of shit. Sad and downcast

210.speaker: He Who Was
210.text: What's this? The ledger is gone - how curious. Without it, the ceremony is an impossibility.
210.context: NodeContext: Patting down his 'pockets' like he's looking for something. Irritated. 'how curious' glares at player with a clear accusation (the player stole the ledger)

17.speaker: He Who Was
17.text: A pity. Should I find another murderer in need of torment, I will find you. Until then, farewell.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: I am here in the honour of justice and order - that is all.

35.speaker: He Who Was
35.text: Then steel your heart - for this woman is a serpent who wears many faces. Do not be fooled.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I know how to break people - don't you worry.

204.speaker: He Who Was
204.text: You break their bones, my friend - a curable malady. I need you to leave her very soul broken and useless.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: She won't know her own name by the time I'm done with her.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Perhaps I will finish what the Dark Justiciars started.

217.speaker: He Who Was
217.text: I thought I the teacher. But I have a feeling I will learn much from you.
217.context: NodeContext: cruel smile at the thought of madeline's pain

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I think I'll just kill you instead.

137.speaker: He Who Was
137.text: A pity, I thought you smarter than this. Come.
137.context: NodeContext: A cold smile, about to begin combat, planning to murder player

108.speaker: Player
108.text: How do you know I have the ledger?

214.speaker: He Who Was
214.text: The raven was right about you. Your name will be remembered.
214.context: NodeContext: this sounds like it could be either a threat or a compliment depending on how you look at it. Cruel smile
